Class RoleList

java.lang.Object
application.RoleList
public class RoleList extends Object
This class encapsulates a user's possible roles. These roles include admin, staff, instructor, student, and reviewer, and can be accessed as private booleans.

  • Constructor Details

    • RoleList

      public RoleList()
      Sets the user and databaseHelper to null.

    • RoleList

      public RoleList(RoleList copy)
      Sets this role list's values to a copy of the other role list's values.
      Parameters:
      copy - the role list to copy.

    • RoleList

      public RoleList(User user, DatabaseHelper databaseHelper, ArrayList<String> roles)
      Sets this role list's values based on the values included in the ArrayList roles.
      Parameters:
      user - the user this role list is associated with.
      databaseHelper - the databaseHelper this role list is associated with.
      roles - a list of roles to set to true from the following: "admin", "student", "instructor", "reviewer", "staff".

    • RoleList

      public RoleList(User user, DatabaseHelper databaseHelper, boolean[] roles)
      Creates a new roleList from a set of booleans, among other things.
      Parameters:
      user - the user whose roles these are
      databaseHelper - the associated databaseHelper
      roles - [isAdmin, isStaff, isInstructor, isStudent, isReviewer]

    • RoleList

      public RoleList(User user, DatabaseHelper databaseHelper, String roles)
      Creates a role list from a set of roles given as a string.
      Parameters:
      user - the user this list belongs to.
      databaseHelper - the database.
      roles - of the following: "admin", "staff", "student", "reviewer", "instructor", any included as a substring in roles will be set to true.

    • RoleList

      public RoleList(DatabaseHelper databaseHelper, String roles)
      Creates a role list from a set of roles given as a string. user is set to null.
      Parameters:
      databaseHelper - the database.
      roles - of the following: "admin", "staff", "student", "reviewer", "instructor", any included as a substring in roles will be set to true.

    • RoleList

      public RoleList(DatabaseHelper databaseHelper, ArrayList<String> roles)
      Sets this role list's values based on the values included in the ArrayList roles. user is set to null.
      Parameters:
      databaseHelper - the databaseHelper this role list is associated with.
      roles - a list of roles to set to true from the following: "admin", "student", "instructor", "reviewer", "staff".

    • RoleList

      public RoleList(DatabaseHelper databaseHelper, boolean[] roles)
      Creates a new roleList from a set of booleans, among other things.
      Parameters:
      databaseHelper - the associated databaseHelper
      roles - [isAdmin, isStaff, isInstructor, isStudent, isReviewer]

  • Method Details

    • setRoles

      public void setRoles(ArrayList<String> roles)
      Any roles from the following list may be set to true: "admin", "staff", "instructor", "student", "staff", by including them in roles.
      Parameters:
      roles - the roles to set to true. Any omitted will be left unchanged.

    • setRoles

      public void setRoles(String roles)
      If the following substrings are found in roles, their values in this role list will be set to true: "admin", "staff", "instructor", "student", "reviewer".
      Parameters:
      roles - the roles to set to true. Any roles not included will be left unchanged.

    • setRoles

      public void setRoles(boolean[] roles)
      Sets the roles of this roleList.
      Parameters:
      roles - [isAdmin, isStaff, isInstructor, isStudent, isReviewer]

    • getRoles

      public javafx.collections.ObservableList<String> getRoles()
      Gets the roles set to true in this role list as an observable list.
      Returns:
      the roles from the following list that are set to true, as strings: "staff", "student", "instructor", "reviewer", "admin".

    • getIsAdmin

      public boolean getIsAdmin()

    • getIsStaff

      public boolean getIsStaff()

    • getIsInstructor

      public boolean getIsInstructor()

    • getIsStudent

      public boolean getIsStudent()

    • getIsReviewer

      public boolean getIsReviewer()

    • setUser

      public void setUser(User user)

    • singleRoleSelector

      public void singleRoleSelector(javafx.scene.control.ComboBox<String> roleBox)
      Puts all of the roles currently assigned as true in this role list into the given combo box.
      Parameters:
      roleBox - will contain the roles that are assigned to this role list.

    • multiRoleSelector

      public void multiRoleSelector(javafx.scene.control.MenuButton menu)
      Returns a menu button that contains all of the possible roles with the ones that are currently true in this role list checked. This method also adds listeners so that changing which roles are checked changes both the properties of this object and the user's roles in the database.
      Parameters:
      menu - the menu button to modify.

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Prints a comma-separated list of the roles set to true in this role list.
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
